title: i don't think there is a cure.

replies.msg:
it's a thought that won't disappear, a known fact.
it almost feels like i know more than you, more than other people, those people who think life actually has a meaning.
i almost feel elevated, because i don't try to make it sinful by giving myself goals like finishing a study or achieving dreams, it's like they're making goals to feel like it actually has a meaning when basically they're just fooling themselves.
i can't go past this feeling, nobody can tell me where we are here for because nobody knows. i could try to see the beauty, to have fun in the things i do but it just doesn't make sense to do or finish things because eventually it feels like it's all for nothing.
maybe it's to be able to do something that makes you happier but then what, maybe it's peaceful and fine like this.
i wouldn't want to get out of it, i feel home, it's something so hard but at the same time so easy, easy to slip back in, sometimes i even long for the moments when i crash so hard.
they all want me to go to the doctor but what are they going to tell me? teach me how to live a pointless life and try to make me feel happy when i accomplish something, which in the end is for nothing either?
it just doesn't make sense. leave me alone.
